boardgame.name: Archaeology: The Card Game
Archaeology: The New Expedition
boardgame.description: Discover the lost treasures of Egypt and make your fortune! _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; You are an archaeologist working the dig sites of the Egyptian desert. Search for the right pieces to complete torn parchments, broken pots and other priceless artifacts. Explore an ancient pyramid hoping to uncover a huge stash of treasure! Trade shrewdly at the local marketplace to increase the value of your collection. Sell your treasures to the museum at just the right time for maximum profit._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;But beware, the desert also has its dangers! A devastating sandstorm can throw your expedition into disarray, and cunning thieves lurk around the dig site ready to steal your prize discovery!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The aim of the game is to make the most money by finding treasures and selling them to the museum. Players find treasures by digging at the dig site (draw pile of cards). Sets of treasures are collected over the course of the game and players choose the best time to sell them to the museum. Once a player sells a treasure set to the museum the value of that set is credited to the player, and is no longer subject to loss or theft._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;If a player finds any maps at the dig site, he can use them to explore an ancient pyramid where more treasures are hidden. Players can trade their treasures with the local marketplace to increase the value of their collection. If a player meets a thief at the dig site, he will use this thief to steal treasure from another player. If a sandstorm hits, all players are affected and may lose some of their treasure._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The player with the most money at the end of the game is the winner._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2008 Boardgames Australia Awards Best Australian Game Nominee
2008 Boardgames Australia Awards Best Australian Game Winner

Episode 18 - Path of Play (Featuring The Mind, Kingsburg, Majesty for the Realm, Clank! In Space! and more!)
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 80

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Sleeved the cards, played it once, unsleeved the cards again. I think that warrants the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;like new_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; condition? :) A bit too light for us to keep it as a 2P game... Copy 32 of 125 (1st edition) /dimi PS : If you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re from the EU, I prefer an international transfer (to evade the costs for Paypal)
Tuckbox version. Shipping is $9. Please ask about combined shipping for multiple items.

Game is new and in shrink. Payment possible via Paypal or Bank transfer. Shipping within Germany: 4,50 Euro. We ship only to EU-countries (insured and with online tracking)! Shipping costs are: * 12,50 Euro * 10,- Euro if you order games for 100,- Euro or more Thank you for your interest and please take a look at our online-shop at www.cosimshop.de !

Z-Man Games (ZMG 4050) Discover the lost treasures of Egypt and make your fortune! You are an archaeologist working the dig sites of the Egyptian desert. Search for the right pieces to complete torn parchments, broken pots, and other priceless artifacts. Trade shrewdly at the marketplace to increase the value of your collection. Sell your treasures to the museum for maximum profit. But beware, the desert also has its dangers! A devastating sandstorm can throw your expedition into disarray, and cunning thieves lurk around the dig site ready to steal your prize discovery.

PAYMENT METHODS: PayPal SHIPPING: Buyer is responsible for all shipping cost. INSURANCE: Insurance is optional on all items, unless noted. RETURNS: New Unopened items may be returned for a refund of the purchase price of the item, excluding shipping charges, within 7 days of the delivery date. All returned items must be in the original packaging and in the condition that they were shipped to you. Defective or damaged items can be returned for an exchange within 7 days of the delivery date. All returns require authorization BEFORE returning the item. If you refuse delivery of an order, we will deduct the return shipping charge from your refund.
